main event: A large ovoid shaped object was observed flying silently at high altitude from north to south in Sault Ste. Marie, Michigan on August 1, 1960.
interesting points: The object was described as grey-white, steady, and internally luminous without a visible shape or structure., The sighting lasted approximately 3 minutes during which the object flew in a straight course without any trail or exhaust., The object's speed was too fast for a jet and its maneuverability was inconsistent with known aircraft., The sighting was tracked on radar by the Sault Ste. Marie Air Force Station but not intercepted., This report indicated that the sighting is one of the best in the area with reliable witnesses, deserving further investigation.
witness description: Stanley J. Sadowski observed the object from his home.
